content: Hey John. I agree with you. Companies are much better served in most cases by having their founders at the helm. But I think that endorsing total control through supervoting shares is not the only way to keep founders in the mix and even in charge, and I really don’t think it’s the best way. For many companies, of course, it’s a moot point. You need to have substantial negotiating power when raising funds to design a board like Snap’s or Uber’s.
